subject: Languages
title: Slang: The Front Line of Language Change
description: Learn Slang: The Front Line of Language Change in one minute.

hook.text: Yesterday's slang is today's standard vocabulary. 'Mob,' 'bus,' and 'phone' were all once considered slang.

buildup.text: Slang is informal language that often starts in subcultures â€” youth, musicians, online communities.

discovery.text: Most slang dies quickly, but some words climb the ladder from slang to informal to fully accepted.

twist.text: The word 'cool' meaning 'good' has survived since the 1940s â€” one of the most durable slang terms ever.

climax.text: Slang is the testing ground for language change â€” new words audition here before going mainstream.

punchline.text: Every formal word was once slang that refused to die.
